text: One of the great tragedies of 2019 is that we no longer get to see John Kelly's reaction to this kind of stuff in real time.
author: BrendanBordelon

text: Small businesses are also potentially in the crosshairs, and some experts are warning of increased compliance costs. Sen. Moran, who's scheduled a hearing next week on the privacy bill's impact on mom-and-pop stores, suggested he's considering a carveout for small businesses.
author: BrendanBordelon

text: Retailers are especially anxious over the threat privacy laws pose to customer loyalty programs, which they say are crucial to the long-term success of their businesses.
author: BrendanBordelon

text: "I would not want to be a retailer right now." As Congress looks to rein in Silicon Valley with a new privacy law, brick-and-mortar businesses worry that lawmakers are ignoring the risk to their own business model. ($) https://www.nationaljournal.com/s/677416/retailers-small-businesses-caught-in-crossfire-on-data-privacy …
author: BrendanBordelon

text: There was a day last fall on Capitol Hill when tech execs were blasted by senators in the morning for not moderating enough content (Russia stuff), then blasted by the House in the afternoon for moderating too much content (bias stuff).
author: BrendanBordelon

text: Identifying yourself as a journalist to shield yourself from criticism that you're a political hack, while you're operating as a political hack, is a Very Not Cool Thing to Do.
author: BrendanBordelon

text: If "highest number ever recorded" includes the couple of years immediately after 9/11, that is truly stunning.
author: BrendanBordelon

text: I know we're supposed to take this seriously - and in a general sense, the pursuit of tech bias by some GOP lawmakers could have real repercussions. But this is Trump's Twitter, where he routinely flails from one issue to the next with little to no plan. Color me unimpressed.
author: BrendanBordelon

text: Does New Zealand have an equivalent to Section 230?
author: BrendanBordelon

text: Is this tech policy news? I can't tell anymore.
author: BrendanBordelon

text: Fascinating column about the role Big Tech played in the Christchurch terror attack. I think it's unfair to blame Facebook or YouTube, but policymakers worldwide are likely to be galvanized by this.
author: BrendanBordelon

text: The Christchurch terrorist appears to have been born in Australia. So for all his concern about violent immigrants, he's the only immigrant who's actually committed a major act of violence in New Zealand.
author: BrendanBordelon
